segments.en: Hello everyone and welcome to EnglishPod.
My name's Erica.
And I'm Marco.
So Marco, how are you doing today?
I'm great.
I'm really happy to be back, ready to deliver another great podcast for all our listeners.
segments.cn: 我很高兴能回来，为我们的听众带来另一期精彩的播客。

segments.en: That's right.
And we've got an intermediate lesson today about spending money.
segments.cn: 今天我们有一节关于花钱的中级课程。

segments.en: Yeah, specifically spending money in a company.
That's right.
We're going to be listening to a business meeting as a company describes how they're spending money.
segments.cn: 我们将听一场商业会议，讨论公司如何花钱。

segments.en: Right.
And they're actually looking at their profit and loss statement.
segments.cn: 他们实际上在查看他们的损益表。

segments.en: So that's kind of interesting.
Okay.
Well, Marco, can you tell us a little bit about a profit and loss statement?
segments.cn: Marco，你能告诉我们一点关于损益表的事吗？

segments.en: Yeah, sure.
Well, all companies come out with a profit and loss statement every year or every three months.
segments.cn: 所有公司每年或每三个月都会发布损益表。

segments.en: And it's basically a document that shows all the money that the company is spending and all the money that the company is earning.
segments.cn: 这基本上是一个文件，显示公司花费的所有钱和公司赚取的所有钱。

segments.en: So it's a document that outlines how much money the company makes and how much it spends.
segments.cn: 所以这是一个概述公司赚多少钱和花多少钱的文件。

segments.en: Right.
So in the end, basically it'll tell you we're making money or we're losing money.
segments.cn: 所以最后，它基本上会告诉你我们是在赚钱还是在亏钱。

segments.en: Okay.
So we're going to be listening to some people discuss a profit and loss statement in just a moment.
segments.cn: 我们将听一些人讨论损益表，稍后就开始。

segments.en: But before we do that, it's time for vocabulary preview.
segments.cn: 但在此之前，是时候进行词汇预览了。

segments.en: Okay, great.
So today on our vocabulary preview, we have two words for you.
segments.cn: 今天我们的词汇预览有两个词。

segments.en: So let's take a look at the first one.
Expenses.
Expenses.
Expenses.
Expenses.
So expenses are things that you have to spend money on regularly.
segments.cn: 费用是你必须定期花钱的东西。

segments.en: Right.
So for example, in a company, regular company expenses are salaries or office supplies or the phone bills, Internet bills.
segments.cn: 例如，在公司中，常规的公司费用包括工资、办公用品、电话费和互联网费。

segments.en: Okay.
And maybe in a household or a family, your expenses might be your food, perhaps your transportation or your rent or your heating bill.
segments.cn: 在家庭中，你的费用可能是食物、交通、租金或取暖费。

segments.en: So these are all things you spend money on regularly.
segments.cn: 所以这些都是你定期花钱的东西。

segments.en: They're expenses.
Expenses.
Great.
Let's take a look at our second word.
Through the roof.
Through the roof.
Through the roof.
Through the roof.
So when something is through the roof, it's really, really, really, really high.
segments.cn: 当某事“屋顶上”时，它真的非常非常高。

segments.en: Really high.
So for example, we can talk about gas prices are through the roof lately.
segments.cn: 例如，我们可以说最近油价“屋顶上”了。

segments.en: Yeah, that's totally true.
Gas prices have gone really high in the past couple of months.
segments.cn: 过去几个月油价真的涨得很高。

segments.en: So when we talk about through the roof, it means that the number is really high.
segments.cn: 所以当我们说“屋顶上”时，意味着数字真的很高。

segments.en: That's right.
We typically use this word with numbers.
segments.cn: 我们通常用这个词来形容数字。

segments.en: It also gives you the idea that the number has risen really quickly.
segments.cn: 这也给你一种数字迅速上升的感觉。

segments.en: Yeah, exactly.
Okay.
So through the roof.
Through the roof.
All right, Marco, do you think it's time for the dialogue?
segments.cn: 好吧，Marco，你觉得是时候进行对话了吗？

segments.en: Yep.
Let's listen to the dialogue.
As always, the first dialogue is going to be a little bit fast, so it might be a little bit difficult.
segments.cn: 和往常一样，第一个对话会有点快，所以可能会有点困难。

segments.en: But don't worry if you don't understand everything because we will explain all of the key language in a minute.
segments.cn: 但如果你不理解所有内容也不用担心，因为我们会在一分钟内解释所有关键语言。

segments.en: Okay, so now the last point on our agenda.
segments.cn: 好的，现在我们议程上的最后一点。

segments.en: Jill, let's go over the profit and loss statement.
Great.
Well, the main issue here, as you can see, is that our expenses are through the roof.
segments.cn: 嗯，主要问题是，你可以看到我们的费用“屋顶上”了。

segments.en: Let's see.
These numbers are off the charts.
What's going on here?
Well, um, sir, the company expenditures on entertainment and travel are out of control.
segments.cn: 嗯，先生，公司在娱乐和旅行上的支出失控了。

segments.en: Look at these bills, for example.
Just this month, we've paid over $20,000 for hotel charges.
segments.cn: 仅这个月，我们支付了超过20,000美元的酒店费用。

segments.en: Oh, okay.
Thank you.
I'll look into it.
The list goes on and on.
Here, this is a bill for $5,000 for spa treatments.
segments.cn: 这是一个5,000美元的水疗费用账单。

segments.en: Thank you.
That will be all.
I'll take care of it.
Look at this one, sir.
$8,000 were expensed in one night at a place called Wild Thing.
segments.cn: 在一个叫Wild Thing的地方，一晚花费了8,000美元。

segments.en: Okay, I get it.
Thank you for your very thorough analysis.
segments.cn: 谢谢你非常详细的分析。

segments.en: Okay, so this accountant, she's pretty thorough, hey?
segments.cn: 好的，这位会计师，她很细致，是吧？

segments.en: She's really persistent about her job, and the manager apparently is a little bit embarrassed.
segments.cn: 她对她的工作非常执着，而经理显然有点尴尬。

segments.en: Hmm, I wonder why that could be.
segments.cn: 嗯，我想知道这可能是什么原因。

segments.en: Well, we'll talk about that in a little while.
segments.cn: 嗯，我们稍后会讨论这个。

segments.en: Why don't we take a look at our language takeaway for today.
segments.cn: 我们来看看今天的语言要点。

segments.en: In today's language takeaway, we're going to look at three words.
segments.cn: 在今天的语言要点中，我们将看三个词。

segments.en: And the first word is expenditures.
Expenditures.
Expenditures.
Expenditures.
So, expenditures sounds pretty close to expenses, right?
segments.cn: 所以，支出听起来和费用很相似，对吧？

segments.en: It's pretty similar, but it has a little bit of a difference.
segments.cn: 它们很相似，但有一点不同。

segments.en: So, why don't we listen to some examples and see if we can understand.
segments.cn: 那么，我们来听一些例子，看看我们能否理解。

segments.en: We really need to control our travel expenditures.
segments.cn: 我们真的需要控制我们的旅行支出。

segments.en: From now on, all managers will fly economy class.
segments.cn: 从现在开始，所有经理将乘坐经济舱。

segments.en: Because of the rise in oil prices, expenditures on food are higher than they have ever been.
segments.cn: 由于油价上涨，食品支出比以往任何时候都高。

segments.en: So, expenditures is the total amount of money that you're spending on something.
segments.cn: 所以，支出是你在某件事情上花费的总金额。

segments.en: Right, that's the total amount of money versus expenses is the things that you spend money on.
segments.cn: 对，支出是总金额，而费用是你花钱的东西。

segments.en: Okay, that's really clear.
Our next word is out of control.
Out of control.
Out of control.
So, when something is out of control, it's... It's crazy.
segments.cn: 所以，当某事失控时，它是... 是疯狂的。

segments.en: Crazy, you can't control it.
Exactly, you can't stop it.
segments.cn: 正是如此，你无法停止它。

segments.en: You can't stop it.
Out of control.
Okay, great.
Now, let's take a look at our last word for today.
segments.cn: 现在，让我们看看今天的最后一个词。

segments.en: Go over.
Go over.
Go over.
Go over.
So, go over is a pretty simple word.
segments.cn: 所以，复习是一个相当简单的词。

segments.en: Why don't we listen to some examples so we can understand go over.
segments.cn: 我们为什么不听一些例子，以便理解复习。

segments.en: Can you help me go over my presentation?
segments.cn: 你能帮我复习我的演示文稿吗？

segments.en: I want to make sure it's perfect.
Let's go over these numbers one more time and make sure there are no mistakes.
segments.cn: 让我们再复习一遍这些数字，确保没有错误。

segments.en: Yeah, this is a really common word and it basically means look at carefully.
segments.cn: 是的，这是一个非常常见的词，基本上意味着仔细查看。

segments.en: Yeah, or review.
In English, we often find simple little words, they fit together really well.
segments.cn: 在英语中，我们经常发现简单的小词，它们组合得很好。

segments.en: And you think, oh, they're so easy, like the word go, over, so easy.
segments.cn: 你会想，哦，它们太简单了，比如词汇复习，太简单了。

segments.en: Yeah.
But it's the way that they interact with each other that makes them...
segments.cn: 但它们相互之间的互动使得它们...

segments.en: Or it makes you sound much better.
Exactly, so go over in this case.
segments.cn: 正是如此，所以在这种情况下复习。

segments.en: We might say, let's go over the lesson.
segments.cn: 我们可能会说，让我们复习一下课程。

segments.en: Let's go over the lesson.
Yeah, that sounds great.
Yeah, and that's a more natural way of saying something like that.
segments.cn: 是的，这是一种更自然的表达方式。

segments.en: Okay, so we've taken a look at our language takeaways for today.
segments.cn: 好的，所以我们今天已经看过了我们的语言要点。

segments.en: I think it's time to listen to the dialogue one more time.
segments.cn: 我想是时候再听一遍对话了。

segments.en: And this time, the dialogue will be slower so we can understand and listen to all the words we just talked about.
segments.cn: 这次，对话会慢一些，以便我们理解并听到我们刚刚讨论的所有单词。

segments.en: Okay, so now, the last point on our agenda.
segments.cn: 好的，现在，议程上的最后一点。

segments.en: Jill, let's go over the profit and loss statement.
segments.cn: Jill，让我们复习一下损益表。

segments.en: Great.
Well, the main issue here, as you can see, is that our expenses are through the roof.
segments.cn: 嗯，主要问题是，你可以看到，我们的支出高得离谱。

segments.en: Let's see.
These numbers are off the charts.
segments.cn: 这些数字超出了正常范围。

segments.en: What's going on here?
Well, um, sir, the company expenditures on entertainment and travel are out of control.
segments.cn: 嗯，先生，公司在娱乐和旅行上的支出失控了。

segments.en: Look at these bills, for example.
Just this month, we've paid over $20,000 for hotel charges.
segments.cn: 就在这个月，我们支付了超过20,000美元的酒店费用。

segments.en: Okay, thank you.
I'll look into it.
The list goes on and on.
Here, this is a bill for $5,000 for spa treatments.
segments.cn: 这里，这是一个5,000美元的水疗费用账单。

segments.en: Thank you, that will be all.
I'll take care of it.
Look at this one, sir.
$8,000 were expensed in one night at a place called Wild Things.
segments.cn: 在一个叫Wild Things的地方，一晚花费了8,000美元。

segments.en: Okay, I get it.
Thank you for your very thorough analysis.
segments.cn: 谢谢你非常详细的分析。

segments.en: Okay, so I got it.
Yeah, it's clear now.
Yeah, and you know, I heard a lot of really great phrases in this dialogue that I'd like to look at now in Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 是的，你知道，我在这个对话中听到了很多很好的短语，我想现在在流利度提升中看看。

segments.en: Great, so today on Fluency Builder we have three words for you.
segments.cn: 很好，所以今天在流利度提升中我们有三个词。

segments.en: Let's start by looking at the first one.
Off the charts.
Off the charts.
Off the charts.
Off the charts.
So this word is very similar to through the roof.
segments.cn: 所以这个词与高得离谱非常相似。

segments.en: Exactly.
It also means really high.
Right, so let's listen to some examples of how we can use off the charts in a different situation.
segments.cn: 对，所以让我们听一些例子，看看如何在不同情况下使用超出正常范围。

segments.en: Example one.
Oil prices have gone up and our costs are off the charts.
segments.cn: 油价上涨，我们的成本超出正常范围。

segments.en: Example two.
Excellent job, Susan.
Your sales are off the charts this year.
segments.cn: 你今年的销售额超出正常范围。

segments.en: Example three.
Our losses are off the charts.
segments.cn: 我们的损失超出正常范围。

segments.en: That's it.
No bonuses for anyone.
So Marco, do you think I can change off the charts for through the roof in these examples?
segments.cn: 所以Marco，你认为我可以在这些例子中把超出正常范围换成高得离谱吗？

segments.en: Yeah, you can.
Definitely.
You can use off the charts or through the roof.
segments.cn: 你可以使用超出正常范围或高得离谱。

segments.en: Both of them mean the same thing.
Okay, so two ways of saying really really really high.
segments.cn: 好的，所以有两种说法表示非常非常高。

segments.en: Really high.
But they're very commonly used in a business setting.
segments.cn: 但它们在商业环境中非常常用。

segments.en: Yeah, that's true.
Okay, so this next word is a phrase that you can use if you want to tell somebody that you'll check something or you'll investigate something.
segments.cn: 好的，所以下一个词是一个短语，如果你想告诉某人你会检查或调查某事，可以使用。

segments.en: Right, and we heard it in our dialogue, so let's listen to the clip.
segments.cn: 对，我们在对话中听到了它，所以让我们听一下片段。

segments.en: I'll look into it.
I'll look into it.
So look into that.
That means I'll check something.
segments.cn: 这意味着我会检查某事。

segments.en: Yeah, I'll see what's happening.
segments.cn: 是的，我会看看发生了什么。

segments.en: Yeah, does it mean you're going to take action?
segments.cn: 是的，这是否意味着你会采取行动？

segments.en: No, it doesn't.
Okay, so I think we've got another word that does mean you're going to take action.
segments.cn: 好的，所以我想我们还有另一个词确实意味着你会采取行动。

segments.en: I'll take care of it.
I'll take care of it.
So this word means that you're going to do something about it.
segments.cn: 所以这个词意味着你会对此采取行动。

segments.en: I'll take care of it.
I will take responsibility.
Exactly, so I will do something about it.
segments.cn: 正是，所以我会对此采取行动。

segments.en: I will investigate and I'll do it.
segments.cn: 我会调查并且我会做到。

segments.en: Yeah, again, two great phrases.
segments.cn: 是的，再一次，两个很好的短语。

segments.en: I'll look into it.
I'll take care of it.
Okay, so now let's listen to the dialogue a third time.
segments.cn: 好吧，现在让我们第三次听对话。

segments.en: It's going to be at its normal speed, but now you have all the tools you need to understand it a lot better.
segments.cn: 这将以正常速度进行，但现在你有了所有理解它的工具。

segments.en: Okay, so now the last point on our agenda.
segments.cn: 好吧，现在是我们议程上的最后一点。

segments.en: Jill, let's go over the profit and loss statement.
Great.
Well, the main issue here, as you can see, is that our expenses are through the roof.
segments.cn: 嗯，主要问题是，你可以看到，我们的开支高得离谱。

segments.en: Let's see.
These numbers are off the charts.
segments.cn: 这些数字超出了正常范围。

segments.en: What's going on here?
Well, um, sir, the company expenditures on entertainment and travel are out of control.
segments.cn: 嗯，先生，公司在娱乐和旅行上的开支失控了。

segments.en: Look at these bills, for example.
Just this month, we've paid over $20,000 for hotel charges.
segments.cn: 仅这个月，我们在酒店费用上花了超过20,000美元。

segments.en: Oh, okay.
Thank you.
I'll look into it.
The list goes on and on.
Here, this is a bill for $5,000 for spa treatments.
segments.cn: 这里，这是一个5,000美元的水疗费用账单。

segments.en: Thank you.
That will be all.
I'll take care of it.
Look at this one, sir.
$8,000 were expensed in one night at a place called Wild Things.
segments.cn: 在一个叫Wild Things的地方，一晚花费了8,000美元。

segments.en: Okay, I get it.
Thank you for your very thorough analysis.
segments.cn: 谢谢你非常详细的分析。

segments.en: Well, Marco, I guess one of the benefits of being an executive in a company, especially a large company, is you get a lot of amazing benefits.
segments.cn: 嗯，Marco，我想在公司，尤其是大公司当高管的好处之一是你会得到很多惊人的福利。

segments.en: Yes.
When you are a manager or a CEO of one of these big companies, you get a lot of great things like, I don't know, a private jet, maybe.
segments.cn: 当你是这些大公司的经理或首席执行官时，你会得到很多很好的东西，比如，我不知道，私人飞机，也许。

segments.en: Well, that's nice.
Or the company often pays for your house or for your car.
segments.cn: 或者公司通常会为你的房子或车子买单。

segments.en: They'll give you a company car.
segments.cn: 他们会给你一辆公司车。

segments.en: They'll pay for your kids' or your children's tuition for high school.
segments.cn: 他们会支付你孩子的高中学费。

segments.en: So there are school fees.
Yeah, yeah.
And also, I've heard about entertainment bonuses.
segments.cn: 而且，我听说过娱乐奖金。

segments.en: Yeah, so you can go out to a restaurant, get the receipt, and claim the expenses at work.
segments.cn: 是的，所以你可以去餐厅，拿到收据，然后在工作中报销。

segments.en: Those are some great benefits, right?
segments.cn: 这些都是很好的福利，对吧？

segments.en: So, Marco, I'm curious to know what our listeners' expenses are.
segments.cn: 所以，Marco，我很好奇我们的听众的开支是什么。

segments.en: Yes, we definitely want to know what crazy expenses you have.
segments.cn: 是的，我们绝对想知道你们有什么疯狂的开支。

segments.en: For example...
Well, let's see.
My spending on Coke Zero has gone through the roof since we started this podcast.
segments.cn: 自从我们开始这个播客以来，我在可乐零上的开支高得离谱。

segments.en: Yes, you spend a lot of money on Coke Zeros every week, right?
segments.cn: 是的，你每周在可乐零上花很多钱，对吧？

segments.en: Yeah, I probably have about, I don't know, ten a week.
segments.cn: 是的，我每周大约喝十瓶。

segments.en: Well, for example, I spend a lot on DVDs each week.
segments.cn: 嗯，例如，我每周在DVD上花很多钱。

segments.en: I usually buy two or three movies.
segments.cn: 我通常买两到三部电影。

segments.en: That is off the charts.
That is off the charts for DVD spending.
So we want to know what you spend your money on.
segments.cn: 所以我们想知道你们把钱花在了什么上。

segments.en: Be sure to go into our community website and tell us what you spend money on.
segments.cn: 一定要进入我们的社区网站，告诉我们你们花钱的地方。

segments.en: That's right, you can find us at EnglishPod.com.
segments.cn: 没错，你可以在EnglishPod.com找到我们。

segments.en: And Marco and I are always there to respond to your questions and comments.
segments.cn: Marco和我总是在那里回答你们的问题和评论。

segments.en: Great, so we'll see you there, and until then, it's goodbye.
segments.cn: 很好，所以我们在那里见，直到那时，再见。
